item.description:
When cybersecurity leadership turns over too fast, risk does not reset. It compounds.

item.description:
The browser protection and detection technology will be integrated into CrowdStrike's Falcon platform to protect endpoints, browser sessions, and cloud applications.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Taiwan Endures Greater Cyber Pressure From China
item.description:
Chinese cyberattacks on Taiwan's critical infrastructure â€” including energy utilities and hospitals â€”Â rose 6% in 2025, averaging 2.63 million attacks a day.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: 'VoidLink' Malware Poses Advanced Threat to Linux Systems
item.description:
Researchers discovered a modular, "cloud-first" framework that is feature-rich and designed to maintain stealthy, long-term access to Linux environments.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Microsoft Disrupts Cybercrime Service RedVDS
item.description:
RedVDS, a cybercrime-as-a-service operation that has stolen millions from victims, lost two domains to a law enforcement operation.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Winter Olympics Could Share Podium With Cyberattackers
item.description:
The upcoming Winter Games in the Italian Alps are attracting both hacktivists looking to reach billions of people and state-sponsored cyber-spies targeting the attending glitterati.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: AI System Reduces Attack Reconstruction Time From Weeks to Hours
item.description:

item.title: New Reports Reinforce Cyberattackâ€™s Role in Maduro Capture Blackout
item.description:
US officials told The New York Times that cyberattacks were used to turn off the lights in Caracas and disrupt air defense radars. The post New Reports Reinforce Cyberattackâ€™s Role in Maduro Capture Blackout appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cyber Insights 2026: Information Sharing
item.description:

item.title: Chainlit Vulnerabilities May Leak Sensitive Information
item.description:

ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: UK launches landmark 'Report Fraud' service to tackle cybercrime and fraud

item.title: Hackers target Afghan government workers with fake correspondence from senior officials
item.description:
Hackers are targeting Afghan government employees with phishing emails disguised as official correspondence from the office of the countryâ€™s prime minister, researchers found.
ğŸ“° Source: The Record | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Lawmakers move to extend two cyber programs (again) in funding proposal
item.description:
The extension in the $1.2 trillion funding deal is the latest short-term solution in a monthslong saga for CISA 2015, which provides liability protections to encourage private companies to share digital threat information with the federal government.
ğŸ“° Source: The Record | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Dismantling Defenses: Trump 2.0 Cyber Year in Review
item.description:
The Trump administration has pursued a staggering range of policy pivots this past year that threaten to weaken the nationâ€™s ability and willingness to address a broad spectrum of technology challenges, from cybersecurity and privacy to countering disinformation, fraud and corruption. These shifts, along with the presidentâ€™s efforts to restrict free speech and freedom of the press, have come at such a rapid clip that many readers probably arenâ€™t even aware of them all.
ğŸ“° Source: Krebs on Security | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Happy 16th Birthday, KrebsOnSecurity.com!
item.description:
KrebsOnSecurity.com celebrates its 16th anniversary today! A huge "thank you" to all of our readers -- newcomers, long-timers and drive-by critics alike. Your engagement this past year here has been tremendous and truly a salve on a handful of dark days. Happily, comeuppance was a strong theme running through our coverage in 2025, with a primary focus on entities that enabled complex and globally-dispersed cybercrime services.
ğŸ“° Source: Krebs on Security | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: UK govt. warns about ongoing Russian hacktivist group attacks

item.title: US Cyberattack Blacks Out Venezuela, Leads to Maduroâ€™s Capture in 2026
item.description:
Julian E. Barnes and Anatoly Kurmanaev report: The cyberattack that plunged Venezuelaâ€™s capital into darkness this month demonstrated the Pentagonâ€™s ability not just to turn off the lights, but also to allow them to be turned back on, according to U.S. officials briefed on the operation. The Jan. 3 operation was one of the most... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Japanese nuclear regulator employee loses phone containing sensitive info in China
item.description:
The Japan Times reports: Japanâ€™s nuclear regulator has reported the loss of a work-issued smartphone containing highly sensitive contact information after an employee misplaced the device while traveling in China late last year. The Nuclear Regulation Authority (NRA) said an employee lost the smartphone during a personal trip to China in November, according to reports... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: How a hacking campaign targeted high-profile Gmail and WhatsApp users across the Middle East
item.description:
Zack Whittaker reports: On Tuesday, U.K.-based Iranian activistÂ Nariman GharibÂ tweeted redacted screenshots of a phishing link sent to him via a WhatsApp message. â€œDo not click on suspicious links,â€ Gharib warned. The activist, who is following the digital side of the Iranian protests from afar, said the campaign targeted people involved in Iran-related activities, such as... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: 4 in 5 small businesses had cyberscams last year, almost half were AI powered
item.description:
Wire Services report: One more reason things cost more today:Â cybercrime. A survey by theÂ Identity Theft Resource Center, a San Diego-based education and victim resource nonprofit, found that 38% of small businesses hit by a cyberscam or breach in the previous 12 months passed those losses to customers by raising prices. Another key finding: Cybercrime against... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Anchorage police department takes servers offline after cyberattack on service provider
item.description:
Jonathan Greig reports: The Anchorage Police Department said it took a range of actions to address a recent cyberattack on one of its technology service providers. A police department spokesperson told Recorded Future News that the incident relates to a cyberattack involving data migration firm Whitebox Technologies, which alerted the police department of a security... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: UK: North West Ambulance Serviceâ€™s increased breach reports may reflect better reporting
item.description:
Warrington Worldwide reports: Newly released figures from Data Breach Claims UK have highlighted growing concerns about data security in ambulance services, as emergency responders are increasingly exposed to cyber risks and information-handling failures. Data obtained by the company shows that North West Ambulance Service NHS Trust has recorded almost 400 data breach incidents over the... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: 2025: Double the breaches, but less patient data compromised
item.description:
Jill Hughes reports: In 2025,Â the frequency of healthcare data breachesÂ moreÂ than doubled. However, the number of patient recordsÂ exposedÂ has significantly decreased,Â indicatingÂ a shift in the data breach landscape, according to a newÂ report from Fortified Health Security. â€œThe healthcare sector is experiencing more frequent cyber events with smaller data footprints, driven largely by ransomware, identity compromise, and third-party weakness,â€... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: UK: Secret gagging order should not have been used to cover up Afghan data breach, Sir Ben Wallace says
item.description:
Holly Bancroft reports: SirÂ Ben WallaceÂ has said he would not have backed the use of a secret gagging order to cover-up the catastrophicÂ Afghan data breachÂ that potentially put thousands of Afghans who helped UK forces at risk from the Taliban. The former defence secretary told MPs on Tuesday that he had directed that a time-limitedÂ injunctionÂ be used toÂ protect... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: How crypto criminals stole $700 million from people â€“ often using age-old tricks
item.description:
Joe Tidy reports on the explosion of cryptocurrency thefts and scams over the past few years. Thereâ€™s a lot of materialÂ in the post, but of particular interest to DataBreaches was this part of his report: â€œData is a common problem as Bitcoin millionaires are becoming so frequent, and there are stolen databases that are... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: SK Telecom files lawsuit to revoke record 135 bln-won fine over data breach
item.description:
Lee Minji reports: SK Telecom Co., South Koreaâ€™s largest mobile carrier, has filed a lawsuit seeking to overturn a record 135 billion-won (US$91 million) fine handed down by the state data protection regulator over a massive data leak last year that affected its entire 23 million user base, industry sources said Monday. SK Telecom filed... Source
